intro: Sceletium anatomicum, commonly known as Kaffir lime, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is often cultivated for its aromatic leaves, which are used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Sceletium anatomicum is also noted for its resilience to drought and its ability to store water in its leaves.
